measured_by: Proportion of bets on the same hand as consecutive outcomes (trend-following metric based on streak length)
justification: “We examined the effect of the streak length of consecutive outcomes on the proportion of bets following the trend… Analysis 1 consistently demonstrated that the majority of baccarat gamblers preferred betting in accordance with trends. This finding aligns with the notion that baccarat gamblers have positive recency.”

measured_by: Change in bet amount with streak length when betting with the trend
justification: “Analysis 3 examined the bet amounts wagered when gamblers followed the trend… the average customer slightly increased the bet amount with streak length… further confirming positive recency.”

measured_by: Proportion of bets on the recent ‘hot’ outcome after a streak is interrupted
justification: “In Analysis 2, we focused on betting behaviors after a streak… to disentangle positive recency from the hot outcome fallacy, we examined whether baccarat gamblers are more likely to bet on hot outcomes than on others even after a streak… which would indicate the hot outcome fallacy.”

measured_by: Proportion of bets on a different hand than the previous consecutive outcomes
justification: “If baccarat gamblers hold negative recency, then they would likely place larger and more frequent bets on a hand different from the previous outcome, especially after a prolonged streak of consecutive outcomes.”
